definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: Bullets hit people , there is a machine gun into the thick meat flu.

sentences.english: Some larches are bent down by the weight of the snow.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些落叶松被厚重的积雪压倒了。

sentences.english: The tea, though freshly brewed, still tastes thick and stale.

sentences.english: The rich scent of rain and wet earth was blowing through the open window.

sentences.english: Measure the treacle accurately as too much will result in a heavy cake.
sentences.chinese: 糖浆的称量一定要准确，糖浆过多会导致蛋糕厚重。

sentences.english: On tiptoes I reached up and opened the heavy door.

sentences.english: In December, we must wear heavy clothes when go out since it is clod at that time.

sentences.english: A weather front is blowing in, and his thick wool cape flutters behind him.

sentences.english: Finally, she wiggled out from under a heavy blanket and out of the machine.

sentences.english: Imitate a Buddha to have very and decorous texture to generally want the Qing Tui is from the open space yet afterward.

sentences.english: By the end of the summer, people were trading thick gold rings for a biscuit.

sentences.english: This stone became the driving inspiration for the design, and is used with great dignity and respect.
sentences.chinese: 运用这种石头，给设计带来了厚重感和尊严感。

sentences.english: Hill with thick, which has the final calendar vicissitudes.

sentences.english: The grampian no, completely is Hollywood like routines.

definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
simple and honest/unsophisticated/(music etc) deep and resounding
deep/profound/(of a person) reserved/undemonstrative/(of a voice, sound etc) deep/low-pitched
dense/thick (fog, clouds etc)/to have a strong interest in/deep/fully saturated (color)
